idea: 6 questions, wavelength => energy, wavelength => frequency, energy => frequency, energy => wavelength, frequency => wavelength, frequency => energy
idea_2: Make these pick-2s or pick-3s, where students need to select true peicees of information from a list
directions_x: Each of these problems will ask you to select more than one choice. For credit, you must select each correct statement. You will not receive partial credit for selecting only one correct statement.

questions.text: A photon has an energy of 6.0 Mega electron Volts. Select three correct statements. You must select all three correct statements to receive credit.

answerChoices.text: The photon is a gamma ray.
The photon is an ultraviolet light wave.

questions.text: An photon has a frequency of 98.5 Mega hertz. Select three correct statements. You must select all three correct statements to receive credit.
